Articles.Content:
Yup! I'm actually modeling my Duna clouds and stuff off of AVP v3 as It's my favorite of his packs. And thanks for the Mun image I'll see what I can do

- - - Updated - - -

Check this post as thats the most updated look for Eve. And yeah, I'm modeling what I do on Duna after AVP v3 as best as i can.

Yeah, that Eve looks nice indeed. THe only problem IMO is that repetitice texture pattern in places where you look at 90 or 45 degrees to ground mesh.

After playing with this for a while, it's time for a bug report and a suggestion. I tried the Ultra Res version of the mod in windows, with these mods (in the album) and it ran very smoothly. The only problems that I encountered was that some planets had a bit of transparency (as in the album) and some times the clouds had some boxes around them. Anyway, really good work. Now, my suggestion is to add the haze effect higher as one of the real life pic below. Other than that, I can't see myself play KSP without this mod:)

Real Life Pic:

http://i.imgur.com/s1KtJbD.jpg

My SVE Album:

Ã¢â‚¬â€¹http://imgur.com/a/XMdTf

In regards to the first picture, I haven't really found a good way of having that not happen, since we can't have volumetric clouds be present at all times as that would kill your frame rate, this is really the only way to do it. The box in the clouds is an issue I know about and have no clue what is coming from but I'm still looking into it.

The second picture I have no clue why that is doing that as I haven't even touched planets/moons without an atmosphere. That isn't from SVE.

The last two pictures, I know about this, it's in the known issues section.

- - - Updated - - -

Yeah, that Eve looks nice indeed. THe only problem IMO is that repetitice texture pattern in places where you look at 90 or 45 degrees to ground mesh.

Not really a lot I can do about that That's stock, not me.

Not really a lot I can do about that That's stock, not me.

Which EVE are you using It seems that it is the latest WIP one, and IIRC it can change terrain textures.

Which EVE are you using It seems that it is the latest WIP one, and IIRC it can change terrain textures.

I know it can change textures but I haven't changed the textures on the surface of Eve so what you're seeing is stock.
Started work on my "Eve Is Gorgeous" Here are some teases.

How do you get that orange-like hue on Kerbin? Looks very pretty!

Here is how mine looks

EDIT: Turns out, I had to be in orbit

Edited October 26, 2015 by Nubzor

How do you get that orange-like hue on Kerbin? Looks very pretty!

Here is how mine looks

http://i.imgur.com/b69WfzZ.jpg

EDIT: Turns out, I had to be in orbit

Yeah Scatterer doesn't show up in the tracking station, only in map view when you're controlling a vessel and when you go into orbit.

- - - Updated - - -

Started work on my "Eve Is Gorgeous" Here are some teases.

Nice!

Just SVE and Scatterer = Jawdropping

Edited October 27, 2015 by Red Iron Crown

Just SVE and Scatterer = Jawdropping

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/SVE/screenshot18.png

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/SVE/screenshot20.png

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/SVE/screenshot34.png

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/SVE/screenshot46.png

Wowsa, those look great. I love how perfectly positioned the airport is in the second picture, totally planned that out... Yup mhmm!

So this is what I've come up with so far for Duna. I'm not going to be able to do it exactly like Astronomer did it in V3. Looking through the files in that he seems to have done a cheaty, hacky way of making the cool looking blue glow on the horizon that one, I don't feel like poking around with; and two, I don't even know if you can do it in the Overhaul version of EVE.

But, there is kind of a blue tint on the horizon as the sun sets and rises. Its not much but the atmosphere layer is there.

So this is what I've come up with so far for Duna. I'm not going to be able to do it exactly like Astronomer did it in V3. Looking through the files in that he seems to have done a cheaty, hacky way of making the cool looking blue glow on the horizon that one, I don't feel like poking around with; and two, I don't even know if you can do it in the Overhaul version of EVE.

http://i.imgur.com/IpPlz6A.jpg

But, there is kind of a blue tint on the horizon as the sun sets and rises. Its not much but the atmosphere layer is there.

http://i.imgur.com/bU1gvgV.png

http://i.imgur.com/0mFxbn7.png

DAMNNNNNNNNNNN. I know that blackrack was adding a blue sunrise and sunset to duna. But man... omg nice work!
Looks like this replacing the default EVE for cinematics for me.

Awesome

Can you do something with Duna surface? I don't mind the color but it should have some texture

Awesome

Can you do something with Duna surface? I don't mind the color but it should have some texture

Yeah I plan on doing that later on. Kerbin only has the custom textures because RVE had it included. Once I get the clouds, atmosphere, etc. on all of the planets I'll go back and do custom textures.

- - - Updated - - -

DAMNNNNNNNNNNN. I know that blackrack was adding a blue sunrise and sunset to duna. But man... omg nice work!
Looks like this replacing the default EVE for cinematics for me.

Glad you guys like it :3

Since the vote is showing that people want all atmospheric planets done first I'm going to head to Jool and then Laythe.
If you'd like to see Eve in "action" here is a cinematic of it :3

I'm updating the poll, it's pretty clear as to what you guys would like me to work on next. Now I need some more feedback!

Edit:

Err maybe not... Can I not delete/update polls... hmmm..

Edit:

Ah hah, Mods need to do it. New poll will be put up later today ;D

Edited October 28, 2015 by Nhawks17

Hey, ran into an odd issue and may be missing something.

Start -- KSP 1.0.4 Linux x64 w/ KSPRC BoulderCo and TextureReplacer files, EVE 7-4, Scatterer latest

> delete BoulderCo and all KSPRC files in TextureReplacer subfolders

> delete EVE folder

> install WIP EVE Overhaul EVE folder only per instruction

> install SVE UR BoulderCo folder

All the land on Kerbin is white (looks like low res snow at the poles almost) and there's an odd orange glow in the dark. Any thoughts? Can provide screenshots later if that would help.

Since the vote is showing that people want all atmospheric planets done first I'm going to head to Jool and then Laythe.

I would humbly suggest doing Laythe before Jool, given the greater amount of player interactivity it allows.

Since the vote is showing that people want all atmospheric planets done first I'm going to head to Jool and then Laythe.

Will you add rings to Jool?

I would humbly suggest doing Laythe before Jool, given the greater amount of player interactivity it allows.

Yeah I've been thinking the same thing, I'm going to focus on Laythe first
Also, the reentry effects are broken.

Will you add rings to Jool?

Its a possibility. That's what the poll was going to be about but I just realized that its not EVE-Overhaul that handles the rings, I believe I'd have to mess with Kopernicus to add rings. Which, I've never touched before so It'll all be dependent on if I know how to work with it. I'll poke it and see how it is, if I can do it I'll actually add the poll that I was going to add but until then, no

- - - Updated - - -

Also, the reentry effects are broken.

Check your other mods, its not me. They work fine on my system.
